particDesc.person:
Amos James (Edmonson County, Kentucky, farmer and merchant)
c1824 <<<<<<< HEAD =======
>>>>>>> 1f1891c7b69823140bf51f8426d6c040bd7dbacc

text.body:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Edmonson County, Kentucky, farmer and merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza Wilsher in Edmonson County on August 26, 1847. Father of Elijah F. James and Milferd E. James. Farmer in Edmonson County in 1850. Farmer and merchant in Edmonson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 7A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, Brownsville, p. 106.
=======
Edmonson County, Kentucky, farmer and merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza Wilsher James in Edmonson County on August 26, 1847. Father of Elijah F. James and Milford E. James. Stepfather of Elizabeth Wilsher and William Wilsher. Farmer in Edmonson County in 1850. Farmer and merchant in Edmonson County in 1860.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 7A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, Brownsville, p. 106.
>>>>>>> 1f1891c7b69823140bf51f8426d6c040bd7dbacc Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Edmonson County Marriages, Film #000367221, p. 20.
